item.description:
This is one in a series of magnetic games designed to be played on your refrigerator (or file cabinet at work, or any other metallic surface).

This is a steeple jump horse racing game, with magnetic racetrack and 2D horses.

The odds vary with each horse, and a spinner is used to determine speed as well as to discover how successfully a horse executed a jump.

The game may be played face to face, or over the course of time, utilizing a Your turn square. Take your turn, flip the square so that your opponent's color is on top, signifying that it's his turn, then walk away. When your opponent sees that he's up, he can stop, play out his turn, flip the square, and go on about his business.

This feature justifies the magnetic aspect of the game. It can be set up indefinitely and be played out as quickly or as slowly as you desire. This makes it suitable for home or office play when you don't have time to sit down and play an entire game start to finish.

This is one in a series of magnetic games designed to be played on your refrigerator (or file cabinet at work, or any other metallic surface).

This is a racing game complete with pit stops and on track hazards, with magnetic board and 2D cars, as well as a spinner to determine speed.
 
The game may be played face to face, or over the course of time, utilizing a Your turn square. Take your turn, flip the square so that your opponent's color is on top, signifying that it's his turn, then walk away. When your opponent sees that he's up, he can stop, play out his turn, flip the square, and go on about his business.

This feature justifies the magnetic aspect of the game. It can be set up indefinitely and be played out as quickly or as slowly as you desire. This makes it suitable for home or office play when you don't have time to sit down and play an entire game start to finish.

This is one in a series of magnetic games designed to be played on your refridgerator (or file cabinet at work, or any other metallic surface).

This is a soccer game, with magnetic board and 2D pieces. A spinner is used to determine various things such as accuracy of a shot, whether a goalie blocks it, etc.

The game may be played face to face, or over the course of time, utilizing a Your turn square. Take your turn, flip the square so that your opponent's color is on top, signifying that it's his turn, then walk away. When your opponent sees that he's up, he can stop, play out his turn, flip the square, and go on about his business.

This feature justifies the magnetic aspect of the game. It can be set up indefinitely and be played out as quickly or as slowly as you desire. This makes it suitable for home or office play when you don't have time to sit down and play an entire game start to finish.

item.description:
First Past The Post seeks to provide a light and enjoyable take on the British election process. Parties fight to win and keep control of constituencies while keeping voters happy with their stances on a variety of issues. It’s a cut-throat and aggressive business but one party will do just enough to get elected by being “First Past The Post”.

Influence the voters, change your own party's beliefs on the issues that count and try to win over the floating voters in the local and general elections!

The game where you and the other players must face and survive Urban Legends. Some legends award you when they come true, others hurt you, and some even kill you. In this game though, death is not the end! Good luck is rewarded with karma points, and the first player with 12 karma points wins.

Includes: a game board, 108 Urban Legend cards, 6 game markers, 72 karma point tokens, a die, and easy-to-learn game rules.

"This game is taken from the book, On Numbers and Games, by John Conway (Academic Press, 1976) and is attributed to Colin Vout." 
http://www.cs.uidaho.edu/~casey931/conway/col.html

Using any map of blank regions, players select colors (crayons) and take turns coloring any region which does not border a region they have previously colored. The winner is the last player able color a region.

This is a great use for completed Sprouts games. http://www.boardgamegeek.com/game/7378

A variant named, Snort, allows bordering oneself but not opponents. http://www.cs.uidaho.edu/~casey931/conway/snort.html

item.description:
Acorn Games has updated their original game from 1999, Dragons & Danes.

They have updated the artwork and changed the name as well as added a new twist with a mini-game within the main game which can affect the outcome.

Dragondisks is an exciting "Combat" style game that uses unique "Throwing Disks" that will either score you points or enter you into a "Battle" mode. You may find yourself in the middle of a "War," fighting a "Skirmish," "Ambushing" your enemy or find yourself saying "OH NO!" as your "Ambush" backfires in your FACE! There is even a side game where you can gamble to win or lose it all within the main game.

On each turn you either win or lose pieces of treasure from your treasure horde. Of course everyone knows, "He who getteth the most treasure WINS!"

Dragons & Danes is hand-crafted in the Acorn Games studio. Each game gets hand-assembled by the in-house game-crafters. The same pair of hands sees each game through from start to finish.

Each set of Dragondisks includes:
1 set of 5 hand-crafted "Throwing Disks"
1 velvet carrying pouch
1 booklet with complete game rules
30 jewel colored "Treasure Horde" pieces

Every game you play is different. The combinations of sites and investment opportunities create exciting options for every player.The basic idea is to move around the board investing in different resorts. You can upgrade these resorts so when landed on by another player the amount payed to the owner is increased.(the concept is very similar to Monopoly)

Created by H. David Jackson, "a computer programmer with long-time fascination for everything pertaining to games."
ISBN 0-930256-10-7

From the book:

12 Exciting new Board Games to be Played by One Person

The complete instructions, game boards, and markers for playing all 12 games are included in this one book.

--Animal: A group of animals have escaped from a zoo. It is your job to bring them back. The animals will try to outwit you!

--Assailant: You have been challenged by an unknown assailant to a duel to the death!

--The Pits: An Ogre from the lower parts of the world has kidnapped Princess Alicia. Your mission is to find the princess and bring her back. You must outwit the ogre. He has killed many people who attempted to save the Princess! [A choose-your-adventure type game.]

--Road Rally: You are the driver of a road rally sports car. You must move your car through a designated course in the shortest length of time without crashing. A very difficult task - you may be killed!

--Challenge Cup: You are the skipper of a racing sloop competing in a challenge cup race. You must sail against obstacles to win.

--Boarding Party: The German U-Boat 103 has been depth bombed and the crew has abandoned ship. They set a time bomb that you and the crew of the USS Fletcher must disarm before the submarine is blown up. You may be killed in the process!

--Medic: A member of your infantry unit is wounded. Your mission, Captain, is to have your medical corpsman retrieve the soldier; however, the enemy is determined that you will not do it, and will do everything possible to stop you!

--Kamikaze: During a battle your carrier has become isolated from the main fleet. You are under attack by Japanese suicide squadrons that you must destroy before they sink your carrier. The odds are against you!

--Tank Corps: The US Patton tanks against the German Panzers. You are the commander of an American Tank Squad that has met the killer Panzers and you must destroy them before they destroy you. They have very important advantages against you!

--Three Day Battle: You are the Confederate General Lee attempting to break the famous fishhook line established by Union General Meade at Gettysburg. If you break through, then Washington falls. You must battle for three days. Your best chance for success is to win the first battle before Union gains strength. Will you be able to do it?

--Iron Ships: You are the captain of the Confederate iron-clad ship Virginia in 1862. You must defeat the Union ship Monitor before you can enter the shipping lanes and sink the ships that are helping the Union cause. Can you break the Union blockade?

--Rescue: As the commander of a Federation Starship your shuttle is out on a mission. The shuttle was disabled by a Klingon Warship. You must rescue the shuttle, which is set as a trap for you, and return to the base with it for repair before your starship is destroyed. The enemy is waiting for you!
The sexy who, where, what and which adult mystery game. Includes game board, 6 game pieces, 13 playing chips, 29 playing cards and rule sheet. For 3-6 players.

name.value: Mensch ärgere dich nicht: Das Knobelspiel

item.description:
Each player has 5 dice with letters a, b, c, d, e, and e. Goal is to collect the letters in that order.

When rolling you (remaining) dice, you can substitute some of them with dice from other players. In this case, they might loose part of the set they already collected (depending on your roll).

item.description:
The exciting strategy football game for "pro-watchers" of all ages"

"I'm proud to have had a part in the making of this game. While it is professional and realistic, the rules are simple enough that young and old can learn to play and enjoy it. Sharpen your competitive spirit, and good luck in outsmarting your opponent." - Jerry Kramer (former Green Bay Packer)

2 to 4 players compete in this roll and move children's game. The object is to be the first dinosaur to move from the prehistoric era to the 21st century with a live dinosaur. Along the way you'll have to fight the other dinosaurs and get past various "earth events". The earth events include "ice ages, volcanoes, earthquakes and meteorites". The game board also features "dino switch" spaces where you get to switch positions with another player's dinosaur and Time warp spaces, where you move ahead or fall back.

Players may choose to be a Triceratops, Stegosaurus, Corythosaurus, or an Apatosaurus.

Each of the 4 Dinosaurs has a colorful card with overlays. The base card shows the Dinosaur bones, the overlay shows the Dinosaur alive. As you get closer to extinction, you flip over the overlays to expose the fossil bones.

For ages 5 and up.

item.description:
Dragon Chess has the same set of rules as Chess. However, the playing field has 124 squares. There are two Dragons per player, each with a Pawn located on the rank in front of the Dragon. The Dragon occupies the outer two squares on the same rank as the King.
The Field has two extra ranks (rows) and files (columns) as well as two flanks each with 12 squares located on either side of the main playing area proving a total playing area of 124 squares.

The Dragon moves and captures on the rank (horizontally), file (vertically) and diagonally, over unoccupied squares and limited to three squares in line.

item.description:
Re-Route: The Marching Season Game covers 10 weeks during the 12th July Orange Marches in Northern Ireland when passions and sectarianism are inflamed. The game is set in a typical year during the wost disturbances sparked by the annual Drumcree Orange Parade along the Garvaghy Road (1995-2000).

The game requires 3 players: The Loyalist player represents certain members of the Protestant community in Northern Ireland, such as the Orange Order, and various paramilitaries (e.g. UVF, LVF, UFF, RHC). The Republican player represents certain members of the Catholic community in the Occupied Six Counties, such as Residents' Groups, and various paramilitaries (e.g. pIRA, cIRA, rIRA, INLA). The final player represents the Royal Ulster Constabulary police force (RUC). The Republican and Loyalist players use cards to influence regions on a map of Northern Ireland, reacting to one another and actions of the RUC player whose objective, in this game, is to reduce the influence of both the Loyalists and the Republicans.

The crux of the game is in judicious playing of the cards: The Loyalists play a March card in Armagh - will you, as the RUC player, allow it to go ahead and risk a Republican Riot; or do you Re-Route that March and risk a Loyalist reaction that may itself provoke a worse Republican reaction?
Should have kept that Tear-Gas card...
A small set of rules for playing with miniatures in scale HO and 1/32.

There are 60 cards with ranks from 1 to 15, quantities ranging from two 1's up to six 15's; 15 of the cards are worth a point each. All cards are dealt out. The player receiving the 15 marked "star-DAH" begins by playing any number of 15's. Each player in turn then either passes or plays the same amount of cards as the last set played, but with a lower rank. When all but one players have passed, the last one to play takes all the cards played and starts a new trick with one or more cards of the same rank. The round continues until all players are out of cards; then point cards taken are scored. The first player to go out begins the next round by getting the two best (i.e., lowest-numbered) cards from the last player to go out, giving any two in return; likewise, the second to go out gets the best card from the next-to-last to go out. (With three players, the first and last to go out exchange one card.) Play continues until one player reaches 50 points.

Balanko is touted as a "new classic from the very first turn" by its designer. It is a straightforward manual dexterity game created by Canadian designer Jamie MacKinnon.

The game is mounted upon the box it is packaged in and consists of a rail upon which a steel ball rolls, a second tethered steel ball, ten scoring bins (50, 100, 150, 200 respectively), and two scoring tracks.

One player begins by releasing the steel ball from its holster, allowing it to roll along the rail. The other player then attempts to knock said ball into one of the various scoring bins using the tethered ball; if that player misses, the other player may catch the swinging, tethered ball and immediately try their hand at knocking the rolling ball into a bin.

Play continues until one of the two players succeeds in scoring. The object is to accumulate 1500 points (though any total works nicely). It's harder than it sounds!

Balanko is wonderfully simple and accessible to almost anyone regardless of age (a suggested age of 3+ is more because of reasonably small pieces than anything else). As it mounts directly onto its packaging, it's easily stored when not in use.

name.value: Charge to Glory: The Battle of New Market

item.description:
Charge to Glory: The Battle of New Market, is a tactical level game simulating the Battle of New Market, May 15, 1864. This battle, which is famous for its charge by the VMI Cadet Corps, prolonged the Civil War by about an additional year as it protected the Confederate bread basket, the Shenandoah Valley in Virginia. The game itself is typical military/wargame fare, but the subject battle is one that is often overlooked.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 6 minutes approximately
Hex: 40 yards
Elevation: 40 feet
Units: Company / Squadron / Section

Contents:
One 22"x34" map
Two countersheets (300 1/2" counters)
One 16 page Rulebook
One 2 page Introductory Game Rulebook
One Union OB Roster sheet
One Confederate OB Roster sheet

The players are gods at the dawn of time, creating earth's landscape and inhabiting it with people. They can command the creation and destruction of continents and the rise and fall of civilizations.

As gods, players seek to gain followers among the civilizations. They offer those followers luxuries, and oversee the building of pyramids and temples on their continents. In the end, the god with the most loyal, wealthy, and powerful followers will become ruler of gods, and wins the game...

Play involves placing triangular tiles to form islands, coastlines and continents. Players can also replace tiles to reform the topography of the planet.

Each civilization is represented by a color, and once a civilization is “born” a player can gain worshipers in that civilization, which in turn may score points for that player in various ways.

The placement or replacement of tiles may result in civilizations migrating, or going to war with other civilizations. These things are resolved by the various icons on the tiles.

The game is fairly simple, but offers quite a lot of tactical possibilities.

item.description: The Peter Gunn Detective Game is based on the highly successful Peter Gunn Television series from the early 1960's. Craig Stevens' character features prominently on the box of this licensed board game for kids 7-14. Each player takes a piece and start in the center of the board. A face-down person (Mr. Aay, Mr. Bee, Mr. Cee, Mr. Dee) and a face-down weapon (hammer, gun, knife, poison) are laid about on the board, and each player gets 2 cards, one showing which person to find, and one showing which weapon to find. Players spin the spinner to move around the board, looking at the face-down pieces in each area until they find the 2 on their cards. They then return to the center, reveal their cards, and tell the other players where their weapon and person are on the board. If they succeed, they win! If they declare wrong they are eliminated.

Storm clouds are on the horizon. In this game, players work together or on their own to get the forest animals back to their den in the Big Tree before the storm begins.

This game includes rules for multiple variants.

name.value: Great War at Sea / Second World War at Sea: Cone of Fire

item.description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

At the turn of the last century, South America seemed poised to make the same economic leap as the northern half of the hemisphere. Fueled by booming exports of grain, cattle, coffee and rubber, Brazil and Argentina saw their economies grow rapidly and at one time both stood among the world's ten wealthiest nations. All that cash led their leaders to seek the prestige symbols of the day: dreadnought battleships. Argentina, Brazil and Chile all built dreadnoughts just like the Great Powers, but none of them ever fired a shot at a foreign enemy.

Cone of Fire is a boxed game for both the Second World War at Sea and Great War at Sea series. The fleets of Argentina, Brazil and Chile plus those of Peru and Uruguay are added to both series, along with ships from Germany, France and Britain. Most of the scenarios, or game situations, are based on hypothetical situations arising from the actual war scares between the South American nations and sometimes European interlopers, and the war plans with which they addressed them. There are also scenarios based on the actual conflicts which took place in South American waters: the hunt for Admiral Maximilian Graf von Spee's German cruiser squadron in 1914, and the hunt for the cruiser that bore his name 25 years later.

Alongside the ships actually operated by the South American naval powers, there are also ships they ordered and did not receive, or contemplated but did not order. The Brazilians have several projected classes of battleships that they never completed, as well as the modern warships they sought from the U.S. Navy during World War II. Argentina and Chile have their projected battleships, carriers and cruisers as well. And there are the actual jet aircraft flown by Argentina and Brazil.

There are six maps, three at Second World War at Sea scale, and three at Great War at Sea scale. These cover the region from south of Tierra del Fuego, the southernmost tip of the Americas, to well north of Rio de Janeiro. There are huge stretches of ocean as well as the narrow, winding channels of the Chilean coast.

link.value: Great War at Sea: Confederate States Navy (Second Edition)
Second World War at Sea: South American Navies
Second World War at Sea: Strait of Magellan

name.value: Play & Learn the Childcraft Quiz Game

item.description:
Play and Learn is a trivia game based on the Worldbook 'How & Why' library of children's encyclopedias.
Players move around a square board and depending where they land are required to take a volume of the World Book encyclopedias and then answer a question after being directed to the required page by the cards.

Suffren in India is a wargame (for 2 players) published in French magazine Vae Victis #34.

It is dedicated to the incredible naval campaign in India (1782-1783), where two equally able admirals fought each other: Hugues for the English side, Suffren for the French side.

item.description:
Each player is an American Christian missionary with the goal of visiting a number of countries on short-term mission trips. Various cards that are drawn poke fun of common experiences of those who go on short-term mission trips, including setbacks in raising money to go on the trip, and (in another country) finding out that the local cuisine does not agree with your stomach.

If you're behind in the game, you can go to a country that does not welcome outside religions - if you are martyred you get an extra bonus. You'd be out of the game but might win posthumously.

From their website.

Favored of Zeus is a card game for two to five people in which you take the place of one of the gods of Olympus. Zeus has declared a challenge among his gods and goddesses to be the first to gather one-hundred thousand followers.

To aid you in this task, you are allowed to choose one amongst the mortals who will champion your cause. This mortal will fight off the obstacles placed in your way by competitors as well as quest to increase your reputation. Along the way your hero can encounter allies to aid him, and you may take control of mighty Creatures that can make your obstacles more difficult for opponents or attack opponents' followers directly.

All you need to play are the cards, two six-sided dice, the game boards for each god, and something to use as a counter for each player (a penny or dime works well). An average game takes 30-60 minutes.

Soul Sight CCG (Customizable Card Game) is a Bible based card game. The cards are put into ply via the quoting of scripture. This game is heavy on memorization. Memory skills and deck building make this a game for ages 8-adult.

You're on a deserted island. But don't worry, you're not stranded - you're with friends and family and you're having fun. You're playing a game where players hide "caches" (treasure chests) for each other to find. The caches contain coins and clues, and you'll use your navigational skills to tour the island and find them. The first person to collect a coin from each player and follow the clues to the "mystery cache" wins the game.

Home Page : http://www.scholartainment.com/pgc.html

From the Publisher's website:

"Behind wooden walls beat hearts of iron..."

— Austrian Admiral Wilhelm von Tegetthoff,
private letter to his mistress, June 1866

In the summer of 1866, the Austrian fleet fought the Italians in the first open-sea battle between ironclad fleets, at Lissa in the Adriatic. An Austrian victory, it prevented Italian seizure of the strategic island of Lissa.

Hearts of Iron is loosely based on the Great War at Sea series of games. The operational part of the game is very similar; there is an operational map of the Adriatic and central Mediterranean, on which fleets move and attempt to make contact. The tactical part of the game is more detailed, with armor (or lack of it), rifled and smooth-bore ordinance, ship maneuvering and leadership playing much more prominent roles.

In addition to the Austrian and Italian fleets, there is the American Mediterranean Squadron that the Austrians believed would fight alongside the Italians, and the Turkish European Fleet that entered the Adriatic to support Austria. Plus the British Mediterranean Fleet and a large French contingent, along with the Greeks, Egyptians and several other smaller navies. There are a wide variety of both operational and battle scenarios, based on extensive archival research into the original reports and dispatches of the Austro-Italian conflict along with many hypothetical engagements.

A circa 1930's English Spears board game.

Roll the dice and move your markers on the bright artwork board, to simulate taking a trip through the countryside. Various events can occur during your trip, depending on where you land.

The goal is to be the first to reach the center position, the family picnic spot.

Plain markers, but a nice board with great bright graphics for the era. And the early edition comes in a beautiful period box with a great painting of a car on the cover.
The spicy dicey adult game of strategy and luck! Contains 6 Libido™ dice cups 36 Libido™ dice, storage bag, and rule sheet. For 2-6 players.
The lusty "inspect and collect" adult card game. Contains 104 Down & Dirty playing cards and rule sheet. For 2 to 6 players.

item.description: The hilarious 'Love Positions' Dice Game. Includes male and female dice, 6 'positions' cards, score pad, rule booklet, pencils and storage pouch. For 2 or more players.

From the box: "The action packed stock market game for 2 to 6 players".

On a board with 2 tracks the players move around the outer track using a d6, landing on squares that let them buy/sell shares, move the share index or gain/lose money.

The inner track (share index) indicates how share prices are altering.

Players try to buy low and sell high, gaining dividends over time. If you get it wrong, you're bankrupt and out of the game.

The game ends when all but 1 player is eliminated or after a set period of time, the winner is the player with the greatest value of shares and money combined.

Similar to the game Simon, Shocking Memory has eight panels instead of four and you get shocked if you make a mistake. This game is not intended for small children or persons with heart conditions.

From the publisher's website:
Put your memory to the test. Repeat the sequence of lights and sounds. Each round gets a little longer and harder. If you can't remember the sequence; thats too bad, we're so sad...ouch! With three speeds even the best players will be sweating.

name.value: NHL Ice Breaker: The Card Hockey Board Game
NHL Ice Breaker: Battle of Quebec
NHL Ice Breaker: The Card Hockey Game

item.description:
NHL Ice Breaker is licensed by the National Hockey League and features the league’s 30 teams plus national teams. You get all the great action of the game on the ice with NHL Ice Breaker. Game play is built around CSE Games' specially-designed 54-card playing deck (52 standard suited cards plus two Jokers). Each action in NHL Ice Breaker is based on the basic principle of high hand wins. Opponents play their card(s) at the same time to battle for puck possession, and the player with the highest hand gets to execute his/her action indicated on the card(s) played.

As players win hands, the puck is moved up the ice (game board) and toward the opponent's net. Along the way, players may land on special “Ice Breaker” squares, which can shift momentum in an instant. Ice Breaker actions include penalties, big hits, turnovers or great passes. Once in the Shooting Zone, it's a classic contest of shooter versus goalie. Did you play your cards right?

NHL Ice Breaker separates itself from other hockey-based games in that it has a true hockey 'feel'. The game is both accurate and fast-paced. Combining elements of popular card games, players must decide how best to play their cards. Cards can be played individually, in pairs, two pair, or three-of-a-kind. It is up to the player to decide which cards to play and how to play them.

The learning curve of NHL Ice Breaker is remarkably low. Typically, the game is learned within a couple of minutes, aided by the built-in familiarity that the playing deck offers. NHL Ice Breaker is designed for one to four players, ages eight (8) and up.

For more information, check out www.csegames.com.

item.description: Board game with a trick-or-treat theme. Each player has four pieces representing members of a family (mom, dad, boy, girl), and a deck of cards used to determine movement. All players flip a card simultaneously, with order of movement determined by characters on the cards. Players move the number of spaces indicated by the number on a card; odd numbers move only one piece, even numbers can be split evenly between two pieces. Spaces on the board result in the gain or loss of treats (victory points). Players can also acquire "trick or treat" cards which can be played for extra movement. Movement is restricted by a rule that a child may never be more than five spaces away from a parent. There are short cuts that may be taken only by a parent and child together.

item.description:
Guadalajara, portrays the operations launched by the Italian CTV (Corpo Truppe Volontarie—Corps of Volunteer Troops) towards Guadalajara with the ultimate objective of taking Madrid and putting a rapid end to the Spanish Civil War. The unexpected and dogged resistance of the Republican Army, which was fully involved in a deep reorganization, caused the failure of this offensive, forcing the Nationalists to give up trying to storm the capital and making them take the long road by capturing the whole country before being able to declare themselves victorious.

After the failure of Franco's Nationalist troops to surround and conquer Madrid during the first months of the Spanish Civil War, Spain looked doomed to a long war of attrition. During this gloomy period, a new force made its appearance -- the motorized Italian Corpo Truppe Volontarie (CTV). Lavishly equipped and overconfident after its first successful performance in the fall of Malaga, the Italians thought they could quickly and easily end the war. Spain was not Abyssinia, however, and Madrid was not Malaga. The new People's Republican Army was no longer the rag-tag mix of militia units that had fought the Nationalists only a few months before. The Italians were repulsed after a fierce campaign fought under very tough conditions. Madrid was once again saved for the Republicans, and two more years of war would ensue.

Special rules regarding tanks, anti-tank defenses, flamethrowers, truck transports, traffic jams, morale, and panic will allow you to recreate the Italian offensive. Will you succeed where your historical counterparts failed? Will you break the Republican lines? Will your volunteers panic as they did in 1937? Prepare to fight what Ernest Hemingway considered one of the most decisive battles in military history.

Four scenarios cover the full campaign, the Italian offensive, the Nationalist "side-offensive", and the Republican counteroffensive which broke the spine of the Italian assault.

Guadalajara is the twelfth game in the Standard Combat Series (SCS) from series from Multi-Man Publishing.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 1-2 days
Hex: .6 mile / 1 kilometers
Units: Company to Battalion

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 32" full color mapsheet
One dual-side printed countersheet (280 1/2" counters)
One 8-page Standard Combat Series rules booklet, Version 1.7
One 16-page Guadalajara rules booklet
One Player Aid card
Two 6-sided dice

Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Medium-Low
Players: 2-3 or more
Playing Time: 2-8

item.description:
From rules: "As a Pro Bowler, you enjoy being on tour, playing tournaments, earning your living by doing what you enjoy most...bowling. You have as a goal, gaining a reputation as a top professional bowler and insuring that you can always earn a living through bowling."

Players move bowling pin shaped pawns on a track that looks like a bowling score sheet, participating in tournaments as they go, collecting money for setting records or meeting sponsors, paying money for purchases or hospital bills, investing in pro shops, and sometimes falling into slumps. For tournament play, a separate pawn shaped like a bowing ball moves along a separate tournament track that looks like a bowling ball knocking down two pins.

To win, players need to collect money and place first in at least one tournament.

The box cover pictures Don Carter and Paula Sperber, who endorse the game and were apparently popular bowlers back in the day.

The players begin their way through the Labyrinth, creating a route for themselves while trying to obstruct the paths of other players.
In the labyrinth which they are creating there are two types of tiles, blue and orange. In the blue ones mummies appear and must be dealt with.
When the players eventually cross the Labyrinth, they begin their way across the Shrine. There, they must confront not only more mummies but also rocks that fall. Both rocks and mummies cause a player to be wounded. The wounds are shown on the cardboard that each player has. When a player receives three wounds, the player dies and is out of the game.
After one reaches the Shrine there is a Treasure. The fist player to get it wins the game.

Trio is a challenging and tactical game for children. In this game you have to move scoops of ice cream around on the board, and try to place three scoops on top of each other in the order shown on your 2 cards. Every time you succeed you win a card. You can also block the other players, by placing a cherry on top of your scoops. Win the most cards, and you will win the game.

item.description: The players try to place their pirates and barrels on the wobbly ship without knocking down the other pirates. A spinner is used to decide on what level the pieces should be placed.

Revenge is a collection of rules specifically written for warfare in the Middle Ages. From the Dark Ages to the rise of gunpowder, war was the sport of nobles who knew that virtue, leadership, and courage were the only principles of war.

Revenge contains three sets of rules each emphasizing a romanticized view of an aspect of medieval battle: Deus Vult is for field battles, Into the Breach for sieges and Sluys for naval warfare.

Deus Vult is designed for 15mm miniatures, each model representing 20 men, but can be easily scaled for use with 25mm miniatures. Meanwhile, Into the Breach is designed for 25mm miniatures representing 5 men each. Sluys is intended for 1:100 scale ship models and 15mm miniatures.

There exists also a supplement, "The Normans", which contains several scenarios for Revenge, but no new rules.

item.description:
Foggle is a mathematical game using 16 dice and a shaker like the letter game Boggle. However in Foggle the dice have numbers instead of letters, and the object is to form valid mathematical equations.

Basic game :
Two or three dice are thrown to create the key number.
The players then have 3 minutes to find as many correct mathematical solutions as possible to generate this key number from numbers resting in a 16 cube grid.

Many different game variations are possible and are all described in the rules.

name.value: O Pulo da Aranha / El Salto de la Araña
O Pulo da Aranha do Gugu

item.description:
The game uses a similar mechanic to Operation and takes two C-cell batteries.

The red molded plastic game base has a silver conductive web on which various plastic critters are placed. A felt spider is situated menacingly next to the web in its allocated position over a small hole, which contains a small mechanical lever-type apparatus inside.

Each turn, players attempt to remove a critter from the web with a pronged device which is connected to the board with a wire. If the surface of the web is touched with this, the circuit is completed, the mechanism in the hole beneath the spider is activated and the spider is launched. Any player disturbing the spider must replace the critter they were trying to get.

The player collecting the most critters from the web without disturbing the spider (touching the web with the pronged device) is the winner.

item.description:
This old game comes in a huge box (20" x 13" x 5"). It consists of five components only - a large plastic clam-like frog with identical halves almost 12" long and wide; two thick plastic oval beetles 4" x 6" and two 20" long solid plastic tubes (the 'boppers'). The two halves of the frog are joined by a hinge at the rear which causes the frog to lock in an open position when set.

The beetles are placed on the ground an equal and agreed distance away from the set frog and must be 'bopped' into the frog using the plastic tubes provided. This is accomplished by whacking the plastic tube on an edge of the beetle, causing it to fly up in the air. The first player to successfully bop their beetle into the frog causes the frog to snap shut and wins the game.

item.description:
IDEAL's treatment of tic-tac-toe enclosed in a large 18" square box.

The large plastic gameboard consists of four gently sloping ramps which extend upward from each side of a tic-tac-toe grid. There is a circular hole in the center of each grid segment to accept players' discs.

Each player is given eight plastic discs of their chosen color and a device to release the discs (basically a circular piece of plastic with a raised slit) down their particular ramp. A turn consists of aiming a disc and releasing it down the ramp. Discs that fail to come to rest completely within a hole are removed from the board and used later if required. Only the top disc showing in any given hole counts in gameplay.

The first player to land three of their discs in holes so that they form a straight row in any direction is the winner.

"BOP UP YOUR BEE BOP, WHEN THE SPINNER POINTS TO YOU...
I'LL TRY TO CATCH YOUR BEE AND WIN A CHIP OR TWO"

"Get ready! Get set! Play BEE BOPPER! One player bops their bee when the spinner points to their color. To win chips, opponents try to trap the bee before it is bopped, or catch the bee in their net after it is bopped. Who's the best BEE BOPPER? ...invite the gang around to find out!"

Players must try to increase their initial complement of ten chips to twenty by catching or trapping opponent's bees with their net. The first to do so is the winner.

The game comes in a large colorful box (16" x 14" x 3") with four nets, four bees, four bopping devices, a spinner and a supply of chips. Apart from the cardboard spinner base, all components are plastic.

A character driven Western tabletop wargame by Game Werks. Players act out gunfights and other "Old West" scenarios involving a handful of distinct characters in miniature.
This game borrows many mechanics from other games, and thoughtfully blends them together for a easy to follow, yet comprehensive, miniatures game. 
Like Mordheim, players are able to advance their characters, and play through many one off, or linked scenarios. Scale is 25mm.
Rulebook is available in print format, as well as a PDF download through RPGNow.com and Wargaming Online.

name.value: Pieces of Eight: The Cursed Blade
Pieces of Eight: The Maiden's Vengeance

item.description:
Adventure and glory await you in Pieces of Eight, the rousing combat game of rival buccaneer ships on the high seas. You play the game with a stack of metal pirate coins held in one hand that represents your ship. The coins you choose and the order in which you place them determine your ship's strengths, and you use the special abilities of your coins to destroy your opponent's coins one by one. Your goal is to expose the Captain coin buried deep in the middle of your adversary's ship, then take him out!

Dare to enter the age of blood and gold with either The Blade or The Maiden's Vengeance ship set. Each set includes all the coins needed for one player to construct his own ship. Your opponents will each need their own ship set to play, but there's no other limit to the number of players who can join in. The coins in each set are not randomized; you can combine ship sets to gain a wider selection of coins and the advantage over your foes.

From the Atlas Games website.

item.description: Each player tries to move his herd of dinosaurs across the finish line first by rolling dice and counting. A player chooses a herd (all Stegasauruses or Dimetrodons or T. Rexes or Triceratops, etc. Each dinosaur in a herd is a different color: red, yellow, green, and purple. A player rolls four dice and puts them in any order he wishes so that they make a four-digit number. Then he moves each dinosaur along a separate colored path: the red dinosaur moves by the thousands digits, the yellow dinosaur moves by the hundreds digits, and so on. Then the next herd of dinosaurs starts their trek on the path to the finish line. Game variations allow for showdowns, "Dino Math Action," and "Prehistoric Problem Solving" for older children.

Times are great for the Candyman. He's just re-opened his factory, sold millions of nut-covered chocolate logs, and taught the world something about love. But too much is never enough. Now he's looking for a recruit from among his staff to pose as his arch nemesis, the Enemy Chocolatier. If you're good enough, that just might be you!

Players start at the Chocolate Factory and take over the city, one house at a time. Each neighborhood earns you money and points. What’s more, you get a little closer to completing your “secret recipe.” Enemy Chocolatier is a Euro-style strategy game with colorful, modular boards and lots of backstabbing and strategy!

item.description:
The Road Runner Game consists of a deck of cards and 8 flat cardboard cutout figures of The Road Runner and 1 Wile E. Coyote figure, both characters from the Warner Brothers cartoons.

The cards are numbered and have brightly colored and patterned backgrounds (one background per set of numbered cards). The cutouts are about 10 inches tall.

The Road Runner and Coyote cutouts are placed in the center of the table. One less Road Runner than there are number of people playing are used.

The players try to collect a full set of numbered cards. The first one to do so lays his cards down and grabs a Road Runner figure. Everyone else grabs a figure as quickly as possible. The last person to grab a cutout (or perhaps a faster person, but one who grabbed the wrong figure) gets the Coyote.

name.value: Professor Noggin's Countries of the World
Professeure Caboche Les pays du monde

item.description: For those who know plenty about their own country, but want to learn about other areas of the world, Professor Noggin offers a trivia game on various countries, and their flags, capitals, languages, traditions, as well as the animals and people who inhabit them.

name.value: Professor Noggin's Countries of the World 2
Professeure Caboche Les pays du monde 2

item.description: A companion game to the original Countries of the World card game. Learn more facts about lesser known countries and the continents they belong to.

Professor Noggin steps back in time to explore lost but not forgotten civilizations. Discover facts about ancient places, philosophers, buildings, clothing, arts, and empires on a trivia-filled journey of discovery.

What did the Magna Carta do for us? Who was Joan of Arc? How did one avoid being burned as a witch? Learn the answers as you travel back in time to a world of knights, battles, castles and cathedrals.

name.value: Professor Noggin's Creatures of Myth & Legend

item.description: Gryphons, basilisks and phoenixes all existed before Harry Potter. Learn about these mythical creatures and explore the science, religious beliefs and cultures that created them.

Keeping in mind that in order to know which way we are headed, we need to know where we've been, this game has trivia on the battles, soldiers, and different aspects of the American Civil War.

Professor Noggin's series of educational games encourages kids to learn interesting facts about their favorite subjects. Each of the thirty game cards combines trivia, true or false, and multiple choice questions.
A special three-numbered die is included which creates interaction and promotes communications between players. Easy and hard levels keep kids interested and challenged - while of having fun!

Sharpen your pencils and prepare to test your wits. In a roller coaster ride aboard the Oriental Express a crime has been committed which only you can solve! Play the role of a famous detective - you could be Sheerluck Homes or Ivan Inkling! It's a hectic race from carriage to carriage as you seek clues and try to fit the missing pieces of the puzzle together.
Instant family fun, this captivating board game will thrill and entertain you as you rush to reveal who it was that dun the dastardly deed!

Contents : 5 foot lay out of a steam train game board, counters, pencils, mystery card deck, score pad, die, rules
In this fun, teasing race game, players attempt to play their cards while calling out solutions to given topics.

Rhyme Thyme is a fast-action matching game that will have you racing to get rid of your cards first. Spot a rhyme in another player's hand and be the first to call out the match. You will need keen eyes and fast hands to "catch the match" in this game.

From publisher:

It's the Annual Alien Conference and the aliens are stuck on the moon without transportation. This is your chance to take an alien home! Maybe not your home... but it's your job to get the aliens back to their home planets. In this trick-taking card game the highest card wins the round. Call out "Beam Me Up" when you have collected three aliens from the same home planet and a Space Racer will come to the rescue. The player who send the most aliens home by the end of the game wins the title of Star Space Traffic Controller!

The game is played in rounds with each player trying to win tricks by playing the highest numbered card. For every trick won, the player who played the highest card gets to choose 1 card from the trick to keep and add to his Beam Me Up line. The object is to get 3 cards with matching elementals in your Beam Me Up line so a Space Racer can be launched to come and transport the aliens home.

From publisher:
It's time for a trip to the woods in this fun game where players scramble to complete their camping trips. Each game is different as you collect food, fun and shelter, while other campers try to sabotage your fun with Camper Dampers. Dodge all sorts of trouble from poison oak and sunburns, to grumpy bears looking for dinner in your tent. Whether by luck, skill or by spoiling the fun for other campers, be the first to finish your trip and win!

It's a whole lot of fun trying to match the pieces of the modes of transportation together. Line up the puzzle cards with the right spot on the game board to reveal the whole picture. Children successfully complete the pictures by using visual clues to match the cards to their boards.

From the box cover:
It's summertime at Adriatic coast. Beautiful girls from all over the world came to enjoy sea, sun and good fun. And here they are... who will have more success? Local guys Roko, Stipe, Ante, Borna, Sale... or maybe you?
In this easy learning standalone card game player takes a role of "GALEBAR" - summertime playboy who competes in winning over lady tourists of most intriguing desires. (Based on true stories from Adriatic beaches.)
Deck consists of 94 cards (36 Ladies, 30 Approaches, 11 Places and 17 Events). When a Lady comes into play, each GALEBAR plays one of his available Approaches. Depending on Lady's Interests (Romance, Sex, Fun and Money), active Place and Event, each player counts his score. The player with the highest positive score wins over the Lady. The end winner is the player with the most Ladies won during the game.

Jetzt fahrn wir übern See... consists mainly of beautifully designed panels showing a picture that represents a children's song. One card is drawn each round, and the song is sung. The kids try to identify and grab the right tile, and the first one who does so keeps it. Whoever has the most titles at the end of the game wins!

The 2013 edition of Jetzt fahrn wir übern See... includes forty songs, with the complete text of each song.

item.description: The players race around the board and answer questions from various movie categories such as Quotes, Cult Cinema, Actors, Genre and so forth. Whenever they get a question right they can mark down points on their marking sheets. However answers a specific number of questions first is the winner. The game comes in a film spool packaging and includes a soundtrack CD over famous movie tunes

name.value: Wordigy: A World of Words for Family Fun

item.description: There are 130 cards, each with a letter and a value (values range from 1 to 5; the same letter can have different values on different cards). There are multiple rounds, with the number of cards dealt to each player increasing from 5 to 10 as the game goes along. Players draw and discard in turn until someone can spell a word using all but one of their cards.

The Dragon Academy has prepared 13 difficult Quests, huge challenges that are made up of many single Tasks. Lead your group of dwarfs with skill and cleverness to achieve as many quests and tasks as fast as possible. With every successful quest your group‘s experience will grow to allow you to solve the later quests with greater skill. The group that fulfills the most tasks will win the game.

name.value: The New York Times Crossword Puzzle Game

item.description:
Players take turns solving crossword puzzle clues before their time runs out, and advancing their pegs along a cribbage-style track based on the number of letters that are in the words they have correctly solved.

The puzzles are actual New York Times crossword puzzles, edited by Eugene T. Maleska, having a copyright date of 1978, and there are 100 of them. Additionally there are another 20 "Junior Level" puzzles.

An approximately two-minute hourglass timer provides the suspense, and players select which clues to answer based on the values on four ten-sided dice.

The player who has advanced his pegs furthest along the track at the end of the game (e.g., when the crossword puzzle is completely solved) is the winner.

item.description:
B.S. is a trivia game that asks players to distinguish the truth from the total B.S. "Is 'Batonophobia' the fear of cheerleaders?" "Do mice cry tears like humans?"

It is a combination of poker and of straight trivia. Players must determine which of 3 random facts is B.S. and they bet on their answers using poker-style betting chips.

Players can also draw "Total B.S." cards, which ask you to shout of out B.S when you think you know which of 5 statements read in a row is B.S.!

The winner of B.S. is the player with the most chips at the end of the game.
